title: Rust produces unlinkable code when writing large arrays

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    let mut file = std::fs::File::create("zeros.dat").unwrap();
    std::io::Write::write_all(&mut file, &[0; 2 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024]).unwrap();
}
```

I expected to see this happen: Either the code compiles or the rust compiler tells me I can't have arrays this large.

Instead, this happened: The rust compiler emits objects that cannot be linked.

<details><summary>gcc error message:</summary>

```
   Compiling foo v0.1.0 (/home/msrd0/foo)
```
